Package turing.server

Class ServerLogic

  • java.lang.Object
    • turing.server.ServerLogic
  • public class ServerLogic
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the decode-execute portion of the fetch-decode-execute cycle of networking requests processing

      • decodeAndExecute

        public void decodeAndExecute​(Message<JsonPaylod> message,
                             Communication<JsonPaylod> communication)
        Decode a given message into a meaningful operation and execute it
        Parameters:
        message - the request message
        communication - the open communication on which to send a possible response

      • login

        private void login​(java.lang.String username,
                   java.lang.String password)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Log-in the given user. The user have to be registered to the service. The user must not be already logged in. Security notes: There is an obvious security pitfall in the way user logging is handled; After a user logs in, the same account can then be used from other clients without the need to authenticate again. This problem would be solved by using an authentication method based on security tokens like OAuth2.0 or by caching cookies on the client machine. Both methods have been considered overkill for the overall project, which is of didactic nature. Response: If the login is successful, the server sends a response message containing the UUID of the user
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • editSection

        private void editSection​(java.lang.String documentName,
                         int section,
                         User user)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Send the client the current working copy of the section of choice and allow the user to modify it. To modify the section, an endEditSection request must be sent to the server by the client, with the modified text as parameter
        Parameters:
        documentName - the name of the document
        section - the document's section's number
        user - the user sending the request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • endEditSection

        private void endEditSection​(java.lang.String documentName,
                            int section,
                            java.lang.String content,
                            User user)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Make the changes to the selected section permanent. An edit section request must have been previously performed by the same user making the end edit request.
        Parameters:
        documentName - the name of the document
        section - the document's section's number
        content - the new content of the edited section
        user - the user sending the request
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getUserDocuments

        private java.util.List<Document> getUserDocuments​(User user)
        Retrieve documents accessible by the user either because he is the owner of the document or because he received an invitation by an other user
        Parameters:
        user -
        Returns:
        A list of all documents accessible by the user
